entries.title: Real-Time Object Detection
entries.summary: Controlled evaluation of a CNN perception system under variable lighting, with emphasis on baseline comparison and reliability-oriented measurement.
entries.researchQuestion: How much robustness can a compact CNN gain under lighting variation without violating real-time constraints?
entries.keyResult: Achieved about 10% classification improvement under controlled lighting variation while maintaining stable runtime behavior.
entries.limitationsNextStep: Generalization under unseen scene composition remains sensitive; next step is broader domain-shift evaluation.

entries.title: Quantitative MRI/PET Analysis Automation
entries.summary: Built and automated neuroimaging analysis workflows with validated preprocessing and quality controls, reducing error and accelerating collaborative analysis cycles.
entries.researchQuestion: Can neuroimaging workflows be standardized for reliable clinical-scale analysis without slowing teams down?
entries.keyResult: Automated and quality-controlled pipeline structure accelerated collaborative analysis cycles by over 70%.
entries.limitationsNextStep: Data heterogeneity still introduces edge-case variability; next step is stronger cohort-level harmonization checks.

entries.title: Stochastic SIQR Disease Modeling
entries.summary: Stochastic SIQR simulation for intervention comparison under explicit modeling assumptions, using Monte Carlo analysis to quantify outcome variability.
entries.researchQuestion: Which intervention assumptions produce meaningfully different outbreak trajectories in SIQR-style simulations?
entries.keyResult: Monte Carlo comparisons exposed clear policy sensitivity across intervention settings under explicit SIQR assumptions.
entries.limitationsNextStep: External validity depends on assumption calibration; next step is broader scenario stress testing.

entries.title: Nonlinear Dynamics Experiments
entries.summary: Computational experiments exploring stability regimes, attractor behavior, and numerical sensitivity across parameter sweeps.
entries.researchQuestion: Where do nonlinear systems transition between stable and chaotic regimes under parameter perturbation?
entries.keyResult: Parameter sweeps identified clear stability-window and divergence-pattern shifts across attractor regimes.
entries.limitationsNextStep: Some phase-space regions remain under-sampled; next step is denser sweep coverage near bifurcation boundaries.

entries.title: Quantum Fourier Transform Simulation
entries.summary: QFT simulation work centered on numerical stability, noise sensitivity, and repeatability across controlled parameter sweeps.
entries.researchQuestion: How does QFT fidelity degrade as circuit depth and modeled noise increase under finite numerical precision?
entries.keyResult: Controlled sweeps revealed measurable amplitude and phase degradation trends as depth and noise stress increased.
entries.limitationsNextStep: Current scope is simulation-first; next step is expanded cross-validation against additional noise and qubit configurations.

entries.title: High-Performance CFD Reimplementation
entries.summary: Re-engineered a legacy CFD prototype into validated C++, applying profiling-guided optimization and numerical verification.
entries.researchQuestion: Can legacy CFD simulation workflows be re-architected for major runtime gains without sacrificing numerical validity?
entries.keyResult: Delivered high-confidence runtime reduction through profiling-led C++ optimization and validation workflows.
entries.limitationsNextStep: Classified context limits artifact release; next step is portability of optimization patterns to related simulation stacks.

entries.title: Low-Latency Voice Interface Integration
entries.summary: Designed an NLP-enabled, low-latency voice interaction layer integrated with legacy systems under secure communication constraints.
entries.researchQuestion: How can a voice interaction layer be integrated into constrained legacy systems without breaking latency or security requirements?
entries.keyResult: Built and integrated a low-latency NLP control interface over secure communication constraints.
entries.limitationsNextStep: Security-scoped deployment limits public benchmarking; next step is broader robustness testing under varied command distributions.

entries.title: Neural Synchrony Modeling
entries.summary: Implemented spiking neural network models and controlled parameter sweeps to analyze excitation-inhibition balance, phase locking, and synchrony behavior.
entries.researchQuestion: Which excitatory-inhibitory conditions most strongly govern synchrony and phase-locking in spiking neural systems?
entries.keyResult: Controlled sweeps identified synchronization trends across conductivity and excitation regimes.
entries.limitationsNextStep: Model assumptions simplify biological complexity; next step is broader parameter realism and comparative model baselines.

entries.title: Sparse Connectivity Visualization Method
entries.summary: Designed a sparse graph visualization approach for neural connectivity change analysis and documented methodology, validation, and limits in a 26-page thesis.
entries.researchQuestion: Can sparse-connectivity structure be visualized in a way that improves interpretability of synchrony shifts?
entries.keyResult: Produced a thesis-documented visualization method that exposed interpretable connectivity-change patterns.
entries.limitationsNextStep: Visualization heuristics require broader comparative validation; next step is testing against alternate graph summarization methods.

entries.title: Simulation and Systems Demonstrations
entries.summary: Presented technical demonstrations covering SIQR pandemic simulation and Unity-based interactive systems, with emphasis on model assumptions and implementation tradeoffs.
entries.researchQuestion: How can complex simulation and interactive system behavior be communicated with methodological clarity to technical audiences?
entries.keyResult: Delivered technical demonstrations that highlighted assumption-sensitive behavior and implementation tradeoffs.
entries.limitationsNextStep: Demo format prioritizes communication over full benchmarking; next step is tighter coupling to reproducible benchmark artifacts.
